intro: Aglaia pyriformis, commonly known as the oval-leaf aglaia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and other hardwood trees. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Aglaia pyriformis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
